column5: Was wondering where you been.Did you get that juice fixed yet? Joe
Got a nice buck this moring just as the sun came up.Got a little cleaning up to do and pics to take.Fresh venison for dinner!! Joe Just got back from dropping him off at the butchers.Hers the pics..
Way to go!!!! Looking forward to the pics!  Virginia is a long drive for supper.....     Here is a funny hunting related video!  http://www.guzer.com/videos/dead_deer_prank.php  Gerritt.
Good shootin Joe. Lookin forward to seein the pics !!!
Nice goin' dude... you killed Bambi...
Congrats Joe!  Enjoy  Whopper
Another pic
Congrats Joe.
Good shootin' Joe
Yummy!!!! That little tractor sure must beat the crap outta draggin' them.
Congrats Joe!. I'm not a hunter myself (not yet   ), but I always enjoy reading about it, seeing pictures.
good stuff on that deer!! its funny because ive been hunting for 5years in th shotgun season and I still have not had the opportunity to shoot one yet. I'll stick to fishing!
Good shootin' TEX

Just finished having the traditional hanging loin venison sandwich.oinons,mushrooms and the hanging loins fried in butter and served on a baguette.It dont get no better than that!!Do y'all cut the hanging loins out up there?? Joe

MMMMMMMMMM, Deer tenders.....(drool)  I always carefully remove the tenderloins from any deer and moose that we get.  They are delicious  I have heard stories of unscrupulous butchers who sometimes 'cough' "misplace" the tenders during the butchering process  Always eaten at camp, roll them in black pepper and coarse salt, and fry in butter, or wrap in tinfoil with a couple pats of butter and place on the coals.  8 minutes, then flip over, 8 more and enjoy!
We do Joe if we butcher it ourselves.
Congrats Joe!  Up here we even do jackrabbit (European hare)tenderloins by "unrolling" em with a knife and frying in butter. Oh and that deer sure is riding in style on that tractor! LOL!!!!!
Its kind of deceiving but that is a 5 foot bucket on the New holland tractor he is riding in.We had to roll his butt to the back and curve his neck out the front to get him to fit.   Art
Nice buck aplumma,now send me my steak lol. Hope all is well with you two.My puter has been down for awhile,too much juice comming from the main line aparently,take care will ttyl.  Steve
and to think I just spent over 40 bux for some venison... 2 steaks and about 7 sausages... Grrrrr.... bambi sure is expensive!!!  Gerritt.
Nice going Joe.....and that bucket sure makes it easy to get them home.....lol.....and Yes,all my buddies "loin out" most all cuts........it's the best .......TC and TTYL....Chuck....
Hey Joe,you guys sure have a funny way of blending into the bush.You wear them sneakers to run them down.LOL   Nice animal bud.   Im still trying
good job, nothing better than the tenderloins.  cant wait till our season opens next week in southern ohio!
Best of luck to you Ox. Joe

Hey Joe, I thought you just hunted them with a paint ball  Me, yesterday I packed 5 bins of bones and scaps for the dogs, did another tonight, have 3 more to go.  Going to have to repack my freezer   .  Nothing better than a winters load of free dog food  Maureen

Good for you Mo.Venison for the pups??Good lean meat they are gonna love it!I have been known to paitball a few deer in the garden in the summer but this one showed no signs of being painted!Art dreads that early morning phone call from the tree stand."Hey Art,get the tractor,we got a deer to gut".He always says,I'll be there in a few minutes.That dude has gutted and skinned more deer than most people and he doesn't even hunt that often. Joe
